synopsis: In episode #12 of PBR, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome the talented musician Valante, who shares his heartfelt journey from childhood struggles with cancer to finding solace in creativity. The conversation beautifully explores themes of vulnerability, the importance of being present, and the transformative power of music, all while providing a refreshing perspective on life and relationships.
quotes: Life needs to happen for a while in order for me to have something to express.
You can always find a reason to feel guilty about your own privilege.
Just because you're not giving up all of your possessions doesn't mean you're not helping and being kind.
I could just lay on the bed and be like, why doesn't everybody just lay on the bed? This is the greatest thing ever.
It takes a village to raise a child.
I always say there's such a fine line between survivor's guilt and a savior complex.
You don't have to sacrifice yourself to make a difference.
If you want to make the world a better place, take a look at yourself and make a change.
It could honestly come from anywhere, I guess you could say.
This is perfect music to exist to.
